Brian Marsh.Action: Carries an armload of textbooks as a graduate student of physics, newly arrived on a prestigious campus.
Glances appreciatively at a fellow student but does not exhibit any unprofessional behavior or distraction beyond a brief glance.
Practices a magic trick but is bad at it, frequently dropping the card and showing frustration.
Offers to help Catherine with theory and suggests discussing it over dinner to ease tension.
Persists in trying to restart a difficult conversation to improve understanding.
Questions Dirac about the lack of information regarding their tasks, showing concern for group transparency.
Helps move equipment into the sanctuary to set up a scientific lab, introduces himself and shakes hands with new team members.
Stops by a broken window and looks out silently, without engaging with surrounding people or explaining the situation.
Carefully probes the innards of mysterious equipment with a fountain pen, showing caution and technical skill.
Admits uncertainty about the contents of the canister and the nature of the equipment, demonstrating honesty but also limited knowledge.
Recognizes the unusual behavior of the phenomenon and attempts to engage Dirac to discuss concerns about the tests and the unexpected nature of the phenomena.
Stops and hesitates before approaching Dirac, showing some uncertainty or lack of directness.
Stands quietly focused on his experiment, shows no direct engagement with the priest's despair or group discussion.
Replies to Dirac's request by commenting on faith's difficulty, suggests some empathy or philosophical reflection.
Insists that others have a right to know about the discovery immediately, showing openness and respect for their agency.
Relaxes and accepts Dirac's cautious approach after initially pushing, demonstrating tolerance and cooperation.
Wakes Walter urgently to ask about missing colleagues and the situation; organizes a meeting and decides to actively search for Mullins.
Does not provide clear answers about missing people and their whereabouts, showing some uncertainty ("I don't know").
Calls out for Mullins to check on him, shows concern.
Responds sharply to Walter's comment by calling him an asshole.
Leaves Walter after the sharp exchange without further explanation or reconciliation.
Does not openly share plans about leaving but shows loyalty by indicating he and Catherine are staying despite others possibly leaving.
Responds calmly and helpfully when asked about the drawing, even though he does not understand it.
Questions why Dirac and the priest were left out of important information, showing concern for inclusion and transparency.
Decides to personally get Dirac involved after learning he was not informed, showing initiative and group-mindedness.
Identifies the urgency of the meeting and takes initiative to get Dirac involved by insisting 'I'm going to get Dirac.'
Does not answer Catherine's question about whether they are leaving, but his facial expression indicates resolve not to leave.
Asks 'Why?' when told Dirac and the priest were left out, showing critical thinking and challenge to decisions.
Only provides vague updates like 'We think they left...' without clear leadership or detailed information.
Suggests the purpose of the vision is to warn and help change the future
Performs a card trick perfectly, engaging others with a lighthearted action
Checks the machines along with others to assess the situation, showing cooperation
Indicates the overhead light to inform others the building power is still on
Grabs Lisa from behind to pull her off Leahy, attempting to stop a violent attack
Backs away after Lisa breaks free, does not escalate violence further
Rushes to help break through barricaded door to reach trapped Walter, coordinates others to assist.
Starts digging furiously at the hole in the wall upon hearing Walter's screams.
Stops digging, puts down the leg brace, rushes over to the door, and begins pulling down pieces of the barricade to help.
Gives clear and direct instructions to Lomax to get behind the door and close it once Brian is in the hall, despite urgency.
Hits the light switch to plunge the lounge into semi-darkness, presumably to enhance tactical advantage.
Throws off Leahy and smacks him repeatedly with a table leg to protect Lomax and gain control of the situation.
Races over and clubs Leahy away from Lomax, showing quick responsiveness and effective physical intervention.
Wakes up startled, scared, and confused multiple times; hesitates before confirming reality by touching the mirror to check his reflection.
Parks himself by a bench and waits while observing Catherine and her companion, exhibiting patience and some observational awareness.
Looks somewhat disappointed and unsure about Catherine’s interaction with another man, showing indecision and lack of confidence.
Not paying attention during a lecture, indicating disengagement and poor focus.
Is distracted during an important lecture, not paying attention to the content being presented.
Recognizes and relates information about Dirac's previous debates on the B.B.C., showing some knowledge and contextual awareness.
Knows about the sudden weekend plan change and calmly discusses it with peers.
Introduces himself confidently and establishes rapport with Catherine.
Smiles and seems relaxed despite uncertainty about the weekend plans, showing social composure.
Teases Catherine with a sexist comment but then admits it and tries to lighten the mood.
Tries a card trick to make Catherine laugh but fails and notices her discomfort.
Recognizes Catherine's defensive reaction but does not effectively address it or apologize.
Carefully untangles himself from Catherine's arms and gets out of bed without waking her.
Makes coffee for both himself and Catherine shortly after waking.
Thinks thoughtfully and looks up at the sun and moon rising side by side, reflecting on his feelings.
Initiates a tender kiss and attempts to communicate something important to Catherine, despite her reluctance.
Begins unloading scientific equipment with the team at the church site, indicating participation in a coordinated effort.
Looks at Catherine silently without reacting or clarifying, potentially missing a moment to assert or explain.
Helps carry equipment into the sanctuary and assist in setting up the lab.
Stops by a broken window and looks outside thoughtfully.
When asked if anyone knows what the situation is about, honestly states 'Not a clue.'
Calmly explains uncertainty about the mysterious canister and handles equipment carefully.
Engages with others in a technical task with cooperation and attentiveness.
Uses technical skills to analyze the equipment and interprets ancient differential equations entered by another character.
Admits uncertainty about the toxicity of the material ('Could be...').
Attempts to engage Dirac in conversation despite Dirac's brusque dismissal.
Stops on the stairs to talk, showing willingness to communicate amidst tension.
Engages in thoughtful scientific reasoning about the life-form growing out of pre-biotic fluid and questions its nature.
Expresses skepticism when reading a cryptic, possibly supernatural message, showing critical thinking.
Calmly analyzes data from his experiment (polygraph machine) despite surrounding tension.
Engages with Dirac privately to discuss sensitive information, showing discretion.
Accurately describes and quantifies the energy burst with precision under pressure.
Does not respond to Walter's dismissive attitude, maintaining focus on the data rather than engaging in unproductive argument.
Analyzes polygraph data carefully and formulates a plausible scientific explanation for unexpected vibrations.
Insists on informing others immediately despite a colleague advising caution, showing some impulsiveness.
Puts his hand softly on Catherine's shoulder, asks if she is all right, listens to her worries with concern.
Speaks quietly and cautiously about the strange power, ensuring they are alone before sharing sensitive information.
Explains a complex and mysterious phenomenon calmly and confidently to Catherine, showing awareness of an extraordinary controlled force influencing reality.
Uses cautious body language to ensure privacy (looking over shoulder to confirm they are alone), indicating thoughtful and careful behavior.
Notices Wyndham's absence and inquires about the time he left, showing attentiveness to the situation.
Appears focused on his own experiments and data recording, indicating diligence and task engagement.
Suddenly leans over Walter's cot to wake him, showing urgency and concern about missing people.
Informs Walter about missing colleagues and upcoming meeting, tries to organize a search.
Does not offer reassurance or comfort to Walter despite obvious tension.
Calls out for Mullins upon seeing the glowing canister, indicating situational awareness and attempt to engage others.
Responds pointedly to Walter's dismissive attitude by calling him out on being assholish, showing confidence and social assertiveness.
Leaves Walter behind and moves off without further plan or coordination visible in the excerpt, a neutral action without clear indication of competence or incompetence.
Explains technical terms patiently to others (e.g., 'Tachyons' as Greek for 'swift one').
Shares information with group members (hands sheet of figures to Catherine, engages openly in discussion).
Focused deeply on problem-solving, uses a deck of cards to think through the puzzle with others.
Correctly identifies 'tachyons' and explains their scientific meaning accurately and confidently to others.
Develops a logical and scientifically plausible hypothesis about future scientists transmitting messages using tachyons, demonstrating analytical thinking.
Engages thoughtfully with the information, shows deep consideration by pulling out the deck of cards and contemplating the problem.
Performs the card trick perfectly, demonstrating skill and confidence.
Quickly checks machines alongside others, noting the overhead light and building power is still on, showing attentiveness and technical awareness.
Pushes on the barricaded front doors with Lomax and looks out through a crack in the wall to survey the situation, demonstrating situational awareness.
Reports that the back doors are blocked and confirms the same condition at the front.
Approaches cautiously with Dirac and Leahy to the sleeping quarters after hearing Walter's warning not to enter.
Grabs Lisa from behind and pulls her off Leahy in a quick physical intervention.
Spins Lisa around and holds her in a bear hug to restrain her.
Backs away after Lisa violently breaks free instead of immediately re-engaging or pursuing.
Commands others to stay back and shouts out to Walter to respond, attempting to exercise control of the situation.
Assesses the situation of the thick wall preventing escape and communicates this clearly to Walter and Catherine.
Does not take action or attempt to find an alternative escape or solution beyond stating the wall is too thick.
Leans out the window and prepares to drop down, asking others to be ready to pull him back up.
Accurately estimates that digging through will take hours when asked about the time needed.
Carefully prepares to be pulled back up after dropping out of the window, demonstrating awareness and caution.

Decides against a rash action when surrounded by armed Street People, assesses the situation realistically, and chooses the only viable escape route by leaping back into the window where allies reach for him.
Considers a dangerous option (trying to scale a huge stone wall) but refrains from it due to impracticality and threat level, showing good judgment.
Suggests trying the hallway after dark, breaking windows, and calling for help.
Listens quietly as Dirac expresses hopelessness, shows concern by staring after him.
Digs away at the wall with the leg brace despite exhaustion, persists in investigating.
Responds promptly to Walter's distant call and acknowledges the situation.
Shows no indication of confusion or hesitation when discussing complex matters like demonic possession with Dirac.
Slowly turns the doorknob, listens carefully, opens the door slightly to assess the situation before proceeding.
When Mullins' arm shoots through the crack and grabs him, Brian reacts quickly to bring the table leg down on the arm, forcing Mullins to release him and jumps back.
Pounds Leahy furiously with the table leg while struggling on the floor.
Crawls away from Leahy lying crumpled on the floor, bleeding, and rolls out of Calder’s reach.
Pounds Leahy furiously with a table leg while struggling on the floor.
Crawls away from Leahy after the fight, avoiding Calder's reach by rolling out of the way.
Dashes into the empty storeroom to reach Kelly despite immediate danger.
Gets knocked down by a flying metal locker, indicating a lack of anticipation or preparedness for the attack.
Fights against three men (Mullins, Leahy, and Calder) with all the strength he has left.
Is trapped against the wall and forcibly restrained by multiple opponents.
Screams upon witnessing an event and only moves across the room reluctantly and in pain after others collapse.
Bends down and stares in pain at the shattered mirror reflecting his own face.
Helps Dirac slowly move the priest down the hall, assisting in an urgent and delicate situation.
Stands alone staring at the pile of shattered glass, seemingly reflective and not taking immediate action.
Wakes up startled and disoriented, reacts to recurring nightmare and tries to call Dirac for help.
Seems overwhelmed and horrified by the supernatural imagery (mirror rippling, Catherine appearing decomposed).
